title: Roman Military Equipment from the Punic Wars to the Fall of Rome (London 1993) well produced, with some very fine drawings

container-title: P.Connolly, Tiberius Claudius Maximus, The Legionary, and Tiberius Claudius Maximus, The Cavalryman (both Oxford 1988). The career of a Roman soldier in superb artist’s reconstructions. R.I.Frank, Scholae Palatinae. The Palace Guards of the Later Roman Empire
title: The Emperor and the Roman Army 31 BC–AD 235
The emperor-ideology, the rewards of service, the soldier and the law, the officers. Valuable, extensive use of literary sources
The horse guard of the fourth and fifth centuries
Service in the Roman Army (New York 1989). The daily life, the duties, and service conditions in the army
Les cohortes prétoriennes
A masterpiece. Describes all aspects of the praetorian guard
A spirited account, mainly of the army in the empire’s first century, with an eye on politics
The Imperial Roman Army (Paris 1989, trans
Wide-ranging, original, a good guide to the scholarly literature
A collection, with photographs and commentary, of the 776 stone monuments left by the equites singulares Augusti, the main body of information about the horse guard
Written from the point of view of the individual serviceman and his career
The Roman Imperial Army
The best available overall work on the Roman army in English, making good use of the archaeological sources
